text:
Hey all, I'm working with a wordpress site that is using the HubSpot api. There is a form which asks for a user to sign up with an email and password along with other fields. I'm looking to leverage the `identify` function to create a Contact on HubSpot which is made with the current call to my app to create a user. One thing I should mention is that I dont have access to the wordpress site code so I'm trying to run JS snippets on the wordpress site in the dev console.
First I execute:
```hq= _hsq.push(["identify",{
    email: '<mailto:cobiTEST@testjs.com|cobiTEST@testjs.com>',
    firstname: 'Cobi',
    lastname: 'TESTER',
    leadsource: 'IC Email Buiilder Demo',
    ic_email_buiilder_demo: 'true',
    phone: '+1123123123',
    jobtitle: 'CEO',
    company: 'CM Dev Team Testers'
}]); ```
Then I execute a track event so the data is passed to HubSpot
```_hsq.push(['trackPageView']);```
The problem I'm running into is that no call is being made to HubSpot to make a new Contact record. Any advice?
